questions.text: Identify the organism from the life cycle:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Strongyloides stercoralis

choices.text: Scalp, epicranium, endocranium and dura
Scalp, synchondral membrane, dura, arachnoid

questions.text: A 5-month-old girl was brought to the casualty with seizures. The paediatrician tries to do CSF sampling. What are the structures punctured by the paediatrician while piercing through anterior fontanelle?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Scalp, dura, arachnoid

choices.text: Montenegro test – Kala azar
Frenkel test – Malaria

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Frenkel test – Malaria

questions.text:
Identify the true statements:

  1. IVC passes through the central tendon of diaphragm
  2. Left superior intercostal vein drains into the azygos vein
  3. There are two dorsal interossei at the middle finger
  4. Superior relation of epiploic foramina is formed by the quadrate lobe of liver
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1,3

questions.text: A 34-year-old man presented with fever and massive splenomegaly. On palpation, the spleen was 15 cm and directed obliquely when measured from the right iliac fossa. Which of the following structures prevent the vertical and downward descent of the spleen?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Phrenicocolic ligament

choices.text: Microscopic agglutination test

questions.text: A sewage worker presented with abdominal pain, jaundice, conjunctival suffusion, and blood in the urine for the past 5 days. Which of the following is the investigation of choice?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Microscopic agglutination test

choices.text: Pancreatic islet cells

questions.text: Identify the given structure:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Pancreatic islet cells

questions.text:
Identify the correct statements-

  1. Incubation period of LGV is 10-30days
  2. Mycobacterium indicus pranii (MIP) was indigenously developed in India for use in malaria.
  3. C.parvum is the most common coccidian parasite to be causing diarhhea in HIV/AIDS.
  4. Ganciclovir resistance is due to mutation in U797 phosphotransferase
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1,4

questions.text: A farmer from Uttarakhand had a thorn prick injury and developed a warty, verrucous growth at the site of prick. A skin biopsy sample was taken and sent for histopathological examination.  Which of the following could be the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Chromoblastomycosis

choices.text: Pigmented septate hyphae at 90 degrees, Mucormycosis
Right angle branching septate hyphae, Fusarium
Acute angle branching hyphae, Rhizopus
Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.text: A patient presented with fever, dyspnea, palpitations, and tachycardia. The echocardiography revealed vegetation in the septal leaflets. Tissue sections from them reveal the following findings as shown in the image. What is the most likely implicated agent?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.text:
Identify the correct statement

  1. Type I collagen is seen in bone and fibrocartilage
  2. Reticular fibres are present in lymph nodes, bone marrow and thymus
  3. Right-left movement is by atlanto-axial joint
  4. Costo-transverse joints are plane synovial joints
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1,3,4

choices.text: SS-RNA enveloped virus
SS-RNA non- enveloped virus
DS-RNA non-enveloped virus
DS-DNA enveloped virus

questions.text: A 5 year old child presented to emergency department with history of rhinorrhea and a mild non-productive cough and red eyes. He hasn’t received his due vaccinations. On examination white lesions against red background seen on buccal mucosa as shown below. What is the likely cause?
questions.solution: Ans. A) SS-RNA enveloped virus

questions.text: All of the following muscles have parallel oriented fibers except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Tibialis anterior

choices.text: It cannot be cultured
Twitching motility is seen on wet saline mount
Cysts are seen on wet saline mount of vaginal secretions
It is not a sexually transmitted infection

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about Trichomonas vaginalis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Twitching motility is seen on wet saline mount

choices.text: Right gastric and right gastroepiploic artery
Right gastric and left gastric artery
Right gastroepiploic and short gastric vessels
Right gastric and short gastric vessels

questions.text: Ligation of common hepatic artery will impair blood supply in?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Right gastric and right gastroepiploic artery

questions.text: Mark the option which develops from the structure marked A?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Median umbilical ligament

questions.text: The organism whose life cycle is shown below is associated with which of the following malignancies?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Cholangiocarcinoma

choices.text: Between two heads of pronator teres
At the level of supinator muscle

questions.text: The nerve being tested here is injured most likely at what site?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Medial epicondyle

questions.text: A patient was suspected to have acute brucellosis. A serum sample was sent for a standard agglutination test. It came out to be negative initially but after serial dilutions of the serum sample, the test turned out to be positive. Which of the following is responsible for the initial negative test?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Prozone phenomenon

questions.text: A patient presents with cervical lymphadenopathy and is found to be retropositive. A fungal culture depicts a velvety growth with red diffusible pigment on the underside, as shown below. Which is the most likely causative organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Talaromyces marneffei

questions.text: A defect in which of the following aortic arches causes a continuous machinery like murmur at infraclavicular aspect?
questions.solution: Ans. C) 6th left

questions.text: A student got his jaw locked while yawning. Identify the muscle attached to the articular disc of the temporomandibular joint?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Lateral pterygoid

questions.text:
Identify the correct statements

  1. Normal prostate volume is 20cc
  2. The neurovascular bundle is located between the internal intercostal muscle and innermost intercostal muscle.
  3. The neurovascular bundle is arranged in the order of vein-artery-nerve (VAN), from top to bottom.
  4. Anterior circumflex humoral artery is a branch of 3rd part of axillary artery.
questions.solution: Ans. A) 1,2,3,4

questions.text: A 35-year-old male with a history of HIV presents with white, corrugated, non-removable lesions as shown. These lesions are asymptomatic and were noted incidentally during a routine dental examination. Which of the following is most commonly associated with this presentation?
questions.solution: Ans. B) EBV

questions.text: What is the vector for the condition diagnosed by the image shown below?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Sandfly

choices.text: Posterior tibial artery
Dorsalis pedis artery

questions.text: Which artery is being palpated?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Posterior tibial artery

questions.text: A militant presents with rashes all over his body sparing the palms and soles. On examination, he was febrile and lice were noted. Which of the following is responsible for his condition?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Rickettsia prowazekii

choices.text: Inserts into the lesser tubercle of the humerus
Primary function is external rotation
Arises from the subscapularis fossa
Supplied by a branch of the posterior cord of the brachial plexus

questions.text: All are true about the muscle whose function is tested in the below shown test except:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Primary function is external rotation

questions.text: Absent cremasteric reflex could be a result of injury to which of the following nerve?
questions.solution: Ans. C) C

questions.text:
Identify the true statements about normal fetal development:

  1. Endovascular type of extravillious trophoblasts invade the spiral arteries lumen
  2. Blood in inferior vena cava has lower oxygen concentration compared to superior Vena cava
  3. Functional closure of the fetal circulatory adjustments occurs in the following sequence: Ductus venosus > Foramen ovale > Ductus arteriosus
  4. The main factor for the ductal closure postnatally is an increase in partial pressure of oxygen (paO2)
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1,3,4

choices.text: Negative catalase test

questions.text: 52-year-old man is hospitalized due to 2 weeks of low-grade fever, malaise, anorexia, and fatigue. The patient has a history of bicuspid aortic valve and underwent aortic valve replacement a month ago. Physical examination reveals a new regurgitation murmur. Blood cultures repeatedly grow gram-positive cocci in clusters. This pathogen most likely demonstrates which of the following characteristics?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Negative coagulase test

choices.text: Only abductor is lateral cricoarytenoid
Recurrent laryngeal nerve supplies all intrinsic muscles of larynx
Sensory supply to the larynx is by superior laryngeal nerve only
False vocal cord is formed by the lower border of aryepiglottic fold

questions.text: Which of the following is a true statement?
questions.solution: Ans. D) False vocal cord is formed by the lower border of aryepiglottic fold

questions.text: All of the following structures are derived from the aponeurosis of the external oblique muscle except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Linea semilunaris

choices.text: Liquid paraffin- Hot air oven

questions.text: A technician wants to sterilize the material of the laboratory. Which of the following is a incorrect combination for him to use?
questions.solution: Ans. B) LJ medium: Autoclave

questions.text: A 23-year-old man comes to the OPD due to penile ulcers that appeared after unprotected sexual intercourse. Physical examination shows 3 subcentimeter ulcers on the penile shaft. Microscopic examination of a scraping from an ulcer base reveals the following. Which of the following medications is most appropriate for this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Acyclovir

choices.text: Supplies lobule of ear
Secretomotor to parotid gland
Runs with EJV in neck
Innervates the angle of mandible

questions.text: Which of the given statement is INCORRECT regarding the marked nerve in the given cadaveric image?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Secretomotor to parotid gland

choices.text: Derived from a type of atavistic epiphyses
Gives insertion to pectoralis major muscle
Short head of biceps takes origin from here
Can be felt in the infraclavicular fossa on examination

questions.text: All are true about the part labelled here except:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Gives insertion to pectoralis major muscle

choices.text: Herpes Simplex virus

questions.text: A 52-year-old man has undergone lung transplantation. Two months after receiving lung transplant, he developed pulmonary symptoms and was diagnosed as having bilateral diffuse interstitial pulmonary pneumonitis and bronchiolitis. Which of the following etiological agent is responsible in this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Cytomegalovirus

choices.text: ADP-ribosylation of G protein

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium shown in the figure below?
questions.solution: Ans. C) ADP-ribosylation of EF2

choices.text: Mesentery of sigmoid colon
Bifurcation of common iliac artery

questions.text: All of the following structures lie in the relation to the left ureter except:
questions.solution: Ans. C) Quadratus lumborum
